flawed_nl_solution:
Three years from now, Kate will be 29 years + 3 years = <<29+3=33>>33 years old.
So by that time, Tully will be 33 years x 2 = <<33*2=66>>66 years old.
This means, Tully is 66 years - 3 years = <<66-3=63>>63 years old now.
Therefore, Tully was 63 years - 1 year = 62 years old last year.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 32, not 33. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
